conversations.value: Look at this picture, Joey. Can you believe how flat and perfect that sand looks? It’s almost as pristine as my kitchen countertops after a deep clean.
Whoa, Mon, that's some serious sand. It's like... smooth. But hey, where's the beach food stand? There’s gotta be a hot dog or an ice cream seller there, right?
There's nobody around, which is kind of refreshing, actually. Imagine how peaceful it must be to walk there without a crowd. Although, I'd have to agree, a snack would be nice...
Yeah, peaceful... and a little spooky. It’s like that movie where everyone disappears, except for that one guy. What was it called? Oh! And does the guy know – Joey doesn’t share food!
Joey, you and your movies. But seriously, focus on the atmosphere! Wouldn't it be perfect for a romantic walk with Chandler? Just the sound of the waves, the gulls...
A walk with Chandler? Y'know I love the guy, but I think I'll leave the romance to you and him. I’d probably just use the time to practice some lines or...
Oh come on, Joey. You can be romantic! Remember when you bought flowers for your date and accidentally made Phoebe think they were for her?
Heh, true. Full disclosure though, I thought the flowers would've scored me points with the date. And hey, I did get Phoebe to help me with a sweet audition once by pretending to be my agent.

That’s our Joey, always finding a way to make things work. But this place in the picture could inspire one of your acting scenes! Imagine it's the backdrop for a dramatic monologue, wind in your hair...
Woah, that's not bad, Mon! The lonely actor, contemplating the vast, unknown sea of his career. It’s deep, like the time I got the meat sweats and pondered the meaning of life.
Just maybe don't mention the meat sweats at your next audition. But I have to admit, I'd love to set up a little dining table right there, have dinner under the stars...
Dinner? Under the stars, with food? Now you're talking my language! But as long as you're cookin', I'm there – no sea food, okay?
It's a deal, Joey. Just promise me you'll try to keep the sand off the food, alright?
Hey, when Monica Geller's cooking, I’d eat it off a sand shovel if I had to! But y'know, not really, right? Because, eww.
Got it, Joey. No sand-covered food. Just a perfect dinner on a perfect beach. Maybe without the shovel.
Oh my gosh, Joey, look at this picture! Can you believe it? The bridesmaid and the best man totally stealing the spotlight from the bride and groom.
Whoa! That's almost as bad as wearing white to someone else's wedding. But hey, at least they're not wearing denim. You remember the one with Ross's wedding in London?

How could I forget, Mr. "I'm wearing my handsomest ceremonial dress pants." But seriously, look at her face. I don't know whether to laugh or to be horrified for the couple. It's their big moment and—
And Chewy there looks like he's about to turn into the Incredible Hulk. Phoebe would say he's totally releasing some kind of suppressed rage or something.
Joey, you can't just call him Chewy. Although, that look is definitely more intense than my turkey carving face, and that's saying something.
Monica, your turkey carving face scares me more than any Hulk. And, you know, if that guy's not careful, he's gonna spit his boutonniere out or something.
Maybe he's just really passionate about the bouquet? Remember how you lunged for the last meatball like it was a life raft?

Hey! Joey doesn't share food... or meatballs. But that lady making the fish face, I gotta hand it to her, she's got a technique that reminds me of my audition for 'Bay of the Angry Pufferfish.' Remember that one?

I remember you practicing in the mirror. Chandler was terrified to go into the bathroom for a week. But back to the picture... Can you imagine if the photographer framed this and gave it to them? "Here's to the happiest day of your life, featuring the 'beach creature showdown.'"
Yeah! And it'd be like, "Bride, groom, what bride and groom? We got ourselves a face-off!" Put that on your mantle.
Picture perfect, huh? I swear, if anything like that happened at my wedding...
Hey, it wouldn't have stood a chance—Monica clean includes Monica-perfect weddings, right?
Exactly, and remember: always the hostess! Now, come on, let's find something a little less... dramatic to look at.

You know, Joey, looking at this old train, I can't help but wonder if it misses working on the railways. You think it ever wakes up in the middle of the night shouting, "I've still got it! Put me in, coach!"
I don't know, Chandler. Do trains even sleep? And if they do, what do they dream about? Tracks made of cheese?
Cheese tracks, yes. Clearly the dream of every retired train. But seriously, it's like looking at a piece of history. This train car's had more comebacks than... well, than your acting career.

Hey! I'll have you know the casting directors are very interested in me. They just keep sending letters saying, "Don't call us, we'll call you." I'm pretty sure that means I'm on the brink of a major comeback.
Oh absolutely, 'cause there's nothing more reassuring in life than accumulating a nice collection of 'we'll call you' letters. It's almost as good as collecting, I don't know, actual callbacks?
Harsh, dude. But hey, look at this thing. Maybe there's a role for me as a train conductor! "All aboard the Joey express! Next stop, success town... or maybe like, sandwich city?"
Success town, population: you. And sandwich city sounds like a crumbly situation waiting to happen, considering your stance on sharing food.
Yeah, well remember what I always say: Joey doesn't share food! Not even if it's with, uh, other trains... Anyway, I think I'd make a great train conductor. I've got the cap already!

Yes, Chef Tribbiani, we still need to talk about the difference between a conductor's cap and a chef's hat. But if train conducting doesn't work out, you could always use that hat for a riveting game of "restaurant." Could that BE any more imaginative?
I'll have you know that I take my pretend cooking very seriously. What's not to like? Hat? Good. Joey? Good. Cooking? Good.
Speaking of things that are good... these old trains, they've got character, don't they? The stories they could tell. Kind of like your diary but with less 'why God, why?'
Oh man, can you imagine the adventures? If these trains could talk, I bet they've seen some things.
Yeah, like the migration of our ancestors from the living room couch to the refrigerator, and back. Truly, a historical journey.
Or the time you tried to make Thanksgiving dinner. Talk about a historical disaster!
Ouch! And on that bombshell, I think it's time to leave this museum. Before we end up in a sarcasm battle in front of innocent bystanders.
Too late, my friend, too late. That battle began the day we met. But yeah, let's grab a bite. I'm starving and, believe it or not, looking at this train is only giving me meat sweat flashbacks.
Then onward to sandwich city we go, my friend. Just promise me you won't start eating the train museum brochure. It's paper, not pepperoni.
Hey, Joey, check this out. What do you think the trajectory of that tennis ball will be, given the angle and the force of that swing?
I don't know, Ross. But look at her go! I bet she's thinking, "How you hitting'?"
Ha! Joey, that's... actually not bad for a tennis pun. But scientifically speaking, I'm curious about the ball's speed after impact. Tennis is really all about physics...
Physics, schmysics! All I'm saying is that she looks like she's got a mean forehand. Speaking of which, you wanna maybe hit the courts later? I'm feeling inspired here!
You, inspired by tennis? I thought your only racket sports were... oh, never mind. Yeah, I'd be down for a game. Could be fun to analyze the mechanics of our serves!
There you go with the analyzing again! Can't we just, you know, play for fun? And hey, as long as we don't keep score, I know I won't lose to you like in that Thanksgiving football game.
Come on, that doesn't count. This time I won't be "distracted" by competitive urges. It'll be a friendly match, just like when I play with Monica. Kinda.
Friendly? With Monica? Ross, playing with her is like going into battle. But alright, let's do this. First one to not get hit by the ball wins!
A no-hit game, then. Although I should warn you, my reflexes are as sharp as... Well, they're decent.
Great! And let's grab some pizza after. And since we're playing for fun, no betting... except maybe on who gets the last slice!
It's a deal, Joey. Pizza is the best post-game snack, though I should probably calculate the caloric intake first...
Ross, no calculating during pizza. It's like a rule. Also, no thinking about dinosaurs jumping over the net. Capisce?
Capisce, Joey. And let's be honest, if dinosaurs could play tennis, that would be both terrifying and amazing to watch.
As long as they're not playing against me! I mean, can you imagine the size of their rackets?
So, check out this setup. Could that BE any more minimalist?
Yeah. I mean, where's the giant subwoofer and the hundred action figures, right?
Exactly! It's like, 'Hey, look at me, I'm a grown-up with an organized desk.' I'm not sure I could live with that level of adulthood.
You? Buddy, your desk is just three old pizza boxes and that weird clapping monkey toy.

Hey, that monkey is an essential part of my creative process. And speaking of creativity, look at this keyboard, it’s completely separate from the laptop. It's like they suddenly realized, 'Oh no, our laptop keys are too close together, what do we do?'
Why don't they just eat a sandwich while they type? That'll spread the keys apart. Speaking of which, you think there's enough space on that desk for a meatball sub?
Only if you don't mind a side of computer mouse with your marinara sauce.

Ha! Good one, man! But seriously, what's up with having a phone standing there looking all important but it's so tiny? It's like, 'Hello, I'm an important businessman, but I also like to play miniature golf on my phone.'

I'm not great at the advice, but how about I sell you a tiny set of clubs to go with that phone? Could BE a new business idea - 'Chandler's Mini Golf Emporium.' It would be a massive success... in a very small world.
Heh, as long as they serve tiny sandwiches at the clubhouse, I'm in. Hey, but you think I could play Angry Birds on that little guy?
With your gaming skills? I wouldn't be surprised if the birds flew out of the phone and started attacking us right here.
That would be awesome! It’d be like we’re living in one of those high-tech 3D movies. Except, you know, I wouldn't have to act; I'd just be screaming and running for real.
Well, at least we know you'd be great at the running and screaming part. Oscars, here Joey comes!
Oh wow, look at that! These planes are like, so in sync, it's almost spiritual, like they're connected by the forces of the universe or something.
Yeah, it's pretty cool. But it's probably more like they're just following really strict flight patterns, right? Like a ballet in the sky, minus the tutus.
Ballet in the sky... I like that! It's so poetic, Joey. I could totally write a song about this. "Planes in the sky, dancing so high, with propellers that go swish, swish, swish..."
Swish, swish, swish, huh? Catchy, Pheebs. Just make sure you don't include any smelly jet fuel, okay?
Don't worry, I'm all about the eco-friendly, smell-the-clean-air vibe. Imagine if birds danced like this with the planes. It would be the ultimate air show.
If the birds are dancing with the planes, I hope they know the choreography. Otherwise, it'd get messy quick. And hey, maybe ducks could join in too. Ducks have good rhythm.
Ducks do have good rhythm! You're like, a secret ornithologist.
Wait, doesn't that mean someone who studies birds?
Yes, and I'm saying maybe in another life, you were a bird whisperer or something.
Heh, I like that. Can you imagine? "Joey Tribbiani – Actor by day, bird whisperer by night."
Now that's something I'd watch! Maybe you could communicate with pigeons and have them fly in formations across the New York skyline.
Only if they can fly in a pattern that spells out "Joey's the best"! But Pheebs, I gotta ask, what do birds eat during these type of shows?
Probably whatever they find on rooftops... or Joey Tribbiani's famous meatball sandwich if they're lucky!
Hey! Joey doesn't share food... not even with birdy friends. But you know what, for you, Phoebe, I might consider making an exception.
Wow, that's quite an honor! The birds and I, we thank you, kind sir.
Oh my God, Joey, look at this! Doesn’t that vintage teddy bear collection just take you back?
Yeah, it kinda does! It's like looking at a bunch of furry little Rosses, all old and sophisticated!

I can totally see Ross geeking out over the historical significance of each bear. But you know, I can't help but wonder who loved these teddy bears before they ended up here. There’s something so nostalgic about them.
Sure, I bet each of those bears probably has a story. Like that one there, with the bandage, probably got into some wild adventures. Probably a bear version of "Die Hard" or something!
A "Die Hard" teddy bear, really Joey? You know, maybe I should start a vintage collection myself. A little something to make our apartment look more... chic?
Rach, you should totally do it. It would be like Central Perk, but, you know, with less coffee and more... fluff.
Just imagine Emma playing with one of these classic teddy bears instead of those... plastic, squeaky things. These have so much more character.
Sure, as long as she doesn't try to feed them to the duck and the chick. Remember how they used to eat everything?
Joey, that was years ago! But actually, that gives me an idea. What if I start Emma’s fashion education with the accessories for these bears? It's never too early, right?
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hold on, Rach. Teddy bear fashion? You do remember what happened with the trifle and the meat, right? Let's not mix things that don't mix.
Point taken, but teddy bear fashion could be the next big thing. And you can help me out! You’d be great at it; you’ve got that natural sense of style.
Well, when you put it like that... Okay, I'm in! It's not like my acting gigs are lining up. Plus, as long as I don't have to share my sandwiches with the teddies, I think we're gonna be okay.
Oh, Joey, this is going to be so much fun! And don't worry, we'll keep your sandwiches safe from the bears.  And from Ross.
Oh my gosh, look at that, Joey! Isn't that just the most beautiful thing you've ever seen?
Yeah, it's pretty cool. It's just a plane, Rach.
Just a plane? Joey, it's not 'just a plane'. Remember when I almost moved to Paris? That could've been me looking down, thinking about all the friends I'd left behind.
I know all about your 'almost' moves. Anyway, how come every time you talk about planes, we end up talking about Paris or Ross or both?
Because, Joey, it was a big deal for me. And... I don’t know, it represents change, possibilities. Kind of like when I left my wedding and ended up in Central Perk with you guys.
And that was the best runaway bride moment ever. You in that dress, carrying that dripping wedding bouquet. Classic Rachel entrance!
Ha-ha, yeah. And now look at where we all are. Can you imagine all the things that must be going on in the lives of the people on that plane?
Definitely - like, someone could be on their way to a big audition in LA, ready to become the next Dr. Drake Ramoray!
Joey, I have no doubt you'll get there. And if you get stuck, just use your famous "How you doin'?" line; they won't be able to resist.
You know it! But hey, maybe someone's up there deciding not to move to Paris and stay with their lobster instead. What? I can be sensitive and remember stuff.
Yes, yes you can, Joey. And I love you for it.
And who knows, Rach, maybe someone's up there eating the best sandwich ever!
That's the spirit, Joey! Always thinking with your stomach.
Hey, a sandwich on a plane is still a sandwich, and Joey doesn't share food, not even at 30,000 feet!
That's true, I wouldn't dare ask for a bite. I've learned my lesson!
Anyway, that plane's cool and all, but you know what would be cooler? If that plane was headed to a place where all the pizzas are free and the sandwiches are endless.
Wow, a Joey Tribbiani paradise! Only you could turn a simple plane into a fantasy about food, Joey.
You got that right! Planes, trains, or automobiles; it doesn't matter as long as they lead to food heaven.
Well, I’m just glad we’re here watching planes and not saying goodbye at an airport, Mr. Tribbiani.
Absolutely, Rach. No goodbyes, just us here and lots of planes. So, you think there's like a Central Perk tray service up there? Because that'd be something.
Look at this, Joey! It's like all the stars aligned to create this perfect urban constellation. Do you ever wonder if the people out there have like, parallel lives to ours?
Heh, yeah, I mean, who knows? Maybe there's another Joey out there eating an even bigger sandwich right now!
Mmm, cosmic Joey with a cosmic sandwich. That's oddly comforting. But, do you see the way the lights kind of dance around? It's like they're having their own little party without us!
Party, huh? Well if that's a party, where's the pizza? You can't have a party without pizza, Phoebs.
Typical Joey! Always about the food. But I'm talking about the energy, you know? It's all... kinetic and intertwined. Just like our fates.

Ahh, you're getting all deep on me, Phoebs. I just see a bunch of people getting to where they're goin'. Me? I'd be heading straight for that bus that says "Neighborhood". Sounds like a place where they'd have great pizza.
Or maybe that's the magical bus that takes you to another dimension! Ooh, like an alternate "Friends" universe. I bet in that dimension, Smelly Cat is a top-ten hit!
Heh, and in that universe, Dr. Drake Ramoray is a real brain surgeon, huh? And maybe, just maybe, sandwiches are meant to be shared... Nah, forget it, even alternate universe Joey doesn't share food.
You're priceless, Joey. But look at those people, just living their lives in this beautiful, messy world. It's kind of poetic, don't you think?
Poetic, yeah. That's the exact word I was gonna use. But you know what’s really poetic? That guy there, he's riding his bike without holding the handlebars. Talk about living on the edge!
I bet that's his way of saying "Look at me, universe, I trust you!" Such a brave soul, like a modern-day knight on a two-wheeled steed.
A knight, huh? Maybe he's on his way to slay a dragon... or a giant sandwich. Man, now I'm hungry.
Well, my noble food knight, shall we venture forth to find thee sustenance?
Lead the way, Lady Phoebe. To sandwiches and beyond!
Would you look at this? Is this a picture of a table at a super boring knife convention or what?
I don't know, man. It looks kind of like the tools they lay out before a big surgery. You think someone's getting an operation?

If that's the case, then I really have to question why someone thought it was a good idea to take a picture right now. It's like, "Hey, before we save this person's life, let's make sure we get a good shot for Instagram!"
Instagram? Don't you mean Insta-glam? 'Cause nothing says 'glam' like a pair of scissors and... is that a bone saw?
Ah yes, the bone saw, which is lesser-known than its cousin, the see-saw, less fun at children's playgrounds across America.
Ha! Can you imagine? "Hey kids, forget the swings, today we're playing on the bone saw!"
And for the record, if I ever end up in an operating room, and the last thing I see before going under is someone snapping pictures of the scalpels, I am not waking up for that follow-up appointment.
Yeah, you'd probably just sleep through it anyway. But hey, I bet you wouldn't mind if the person taking the picture was like a pretty nurse, huh?
Nurse Pretty taking my picture... In that case, could I BE any more unconscious?
You'd probably wake up just to flirt and then faint again.
Joey, please. I would wake up, say something incredibly charming and witty, and then faint. Get it right.
Like that time you tried to talk to that girl at Central Perk and spilled coffee all over yourself?
Remind me again why we're friends who share everything, including humiliating memories?
Because I make you look good by comparison.
...And there's my reason.
Oh wow, Joey, look at this! It's a train, but it's not just any train—it's all vintage and kind of majestic, don't you think?
Yeah, Rach, I see it! It’s got that old school vibe, like something you'd see in one of those classic movies. Imagine if we were in one of those, huh?

Totally, like one of those romantic period pieces! But, then again, you and I on a vintage train? There's no way we wouldn't stand out. My wardrobe would be all wrong, and you’d basically be Joey Tribbiani in vintage clothing!
Hey, I could pull off a vintage look! You know, the classic Italian film star—very suave, very debonair. How you doin', signorina?
Oh, Joey! You and that line! Honestly though, could you imagine the adventures we'd have on a train like that? Traveling cross-country, dining in one of those fancy onboard restaurants...

As long as there's spaghetti and meatballs, Rach, I'm there! Plus, trains are cool, you know? Just the sound of the tracks, and all the people you meet... But, uh, just to be clear, we're not sharing food. Joey doesn't share food—especially not on a train!
Of course, how could I forget? You, food, and sharing—it's like trying to mix oil and water. But you've gotta admit, eating on a moving train would make every bite taste better somehow, right?

Definitely! It's like, the motion of the train adds a little... what's the word... ambiance! Yeah, that’s right. It's all about the ambiance. Plus, eating a sandwich as the world whizzes by? That's living the dream, Rach.
For you, Joey, I'm pretty sure eating a sandwich in any situation is living the dream! But I have to agree, there's something so... romantic and timeless about trains. It's a whole experience.
Absolutely, and hey, maybe I could even shoot a movie on a train like that. Y'know, a mystery thriller! Joey Tribbiani as the smooth-talking detective with a sharp suit and sharper wit.
A sharp wit, Joey? Are we still talking about you here?
Hey! I can be sharp... sometimes... Anyway, if you're my stylish sidekick, we’d make quite the team. Solving crimes and looking good!

I'm all for that. But if we’re doing a mystery on a train, then I want one of those glamorous dresses and a dazzling mystery to match. Who knows? Maybe I'll uncover the secret before you do, Detective Tribbiani!

That's a challenge I'm willing to take! But I’ve gotta warn you, Rachel, when it comes to mysteries, Joey knows his stuff. Remember when I figured out who was stealing Ross’s sandwiches? It was him all along!

Oh my God, that's right! The mystery of the missing sandwiches—such a high-stakes case, Joey! But alright, let's make a deal: if we ever get to go on a train like this, we are totally throwing a mystery party.
It’s a deal! And if someone brings a trifle, I’m calling dibs on solving that sweet mystery first!
Joey, look at this image. Doesn't it look like one of those places we saw on TV the other day, maybe in England or something? It's so neat and organized.
England, huh? That's where Chandler kissed my sister! But yeah, it looks kinda familiar, Monica. Maybe it's that place with the big clock!
The big clock? You mean Big Ben?
Yeah, that's the one! But hey, check out that sign. There's a lot going on there, huh?
Absolutely. I mean, it's clearly marked as a bus lane during certain hours. Only in England would they have such strict rules. It's almost like they want things 'Monica clean'.
Ha! Monica clean—is that even a thing here? But why would you drive a bus there? Imagine all the great food places you'd miss walking!
Joey, not everything is about food. But I have to admit, I wouldn't mind exploring the food scene there. Maybe they have a Michelin-starred restaurant just around the corner.
Michelin what now? If they've got sandwiches, I'm in. But look at that tree behind the sign. It's kinda like the ones we have in Central Park.
That's an interesting observation, Joey. Who knew you'd appreciate nature too? It looks well-maintained, though, doesn't it?
Yeah, it's nice, but where are all the people? It's like they're missing out on a Joey special—my tour of good eats!
Maybe we should go there someday, you can give your food tour, and I can try to organize something. It'd be like a 'Friends' trip to England!
As long as we can get some pizza or a sandwich on your organized tour, I'm all for it, Monica! How you doin', England?
Oh Joey, never change. I'm sure England would be doing just fine with you there. Now, let's see if we can actually plan this trip. I'll start making a list.
And I’ll start looking up all the food places! You make the plans, and I’ll be there with an empty stomach!
Look at that, Joe. That's the kind of architecture that just screams history. Can you imagine all the stories that clock tower could tell?
Yeah, it kinda looks like something out of a movie. You know, one of those where it strikes midnight, and everything goes bananas!
You know, it's fascinating. Clock towers were vital in the 19th century. They were like a communal timekeeper before everyone had watches. I wonder how accurate it still is.
I bet it's as accurate as my watch. You know the one that stops every time I forget to wind it? That's a classic Joey timekeeping.

It's pretty impressive though. I mean, look at the lighting. It gives the tower such a dramatic effect. Like something you'd appreciate during one of your more...what's the word, introspective moments?
Oh yeah, those moments when I'm thinking deep, deep thoughts... like, what's for dinner? But seriously, Ross, it's pretty cool. And man, look how tall it is! It's almost like it's touching the sky!
And you know what's even more impressive? Each face of that clock is probably large enough to fit the entire "Friends" cast. It's monumental, really.
Hey, we could totally use a clock tower in the next play I'm in! You know, like a big dramatic scene where I realize I'm late for something super important - like a date with a beautiful woman!
Only you, Joey, only you could turn a historical landmark into a prop for your dating mishaps. But I like the sound of that, it could resonate with the audience's sense of urgency.
Exactly! And it'd be even better if I could take that clock home with me. You know, to make sure I never miss a meal.
For a man of science, I have to admit, you have quite the unique perspective on things, my friend.
That's me, Joey Tribbiani – adding a bit of character to life and to clock towers, one role at a time. How you doin', old clock tower?
Look at this, Joey. All these people with the umbrellas... it's like synchronized swimming without the pool.
Whoa, that's a lot of umbrellas! Do you think it’s gonna rain meatballs or something?
Sweetie, it's not because of the weather. See the logo? WWF. World Wildlife Fund, I think, not the wrestling thing.
Right, right. The panda thing, not the chair-smashing thing. Heh. But Monica, why would they need umbrellas? Pandas don't use umbrellas!
It's symbolic, Joey. They are probably making a statement about protecting the environment, like a shield... Not just clean, Monica clean, you know?
Like an umbrella for the Earth! But, uh, how are they gonna cover the whole planet with those?
Joey, it's about raising awareness, not literally covering the Earth. You know, to get people talking about the cause.
Gotcha. Awareness. So, are we supposed to do something? Like, do they need volunteers? ‘Cause I can totally see you giving orders with a giant umbrella, Monica.
Very funny, Joey. Maybe I could organize an event... You know, with the right planning, this could turn into something big. And I'm always the hostess!
Yeah, and I can be the entertainer! I’ll even share my sandwich for a good cause. Well, maybe just a bite. Remember, Joey doesn't share food!
I won't forget. But let's keep an eye on this. If there’s a way to help out, I want to be involved. It’s important, and hey, it might even be fun.
Absolutely, Mon! Just let me know what I can do. And hey, if there’s gonna be food, you can totally count on me to be there. How you doin', giant umbrella event?
Oh look, Joey, it's a classic street scene. There's something otherworldly about it, don’t you think? Like, maybe there’s a spirit guardian for the fire hydrant or something.

Phoebes, you think there's a spirit guardian for everything. But, hey, I wouldn't mind being the guardian of that motorcycle. It looks sweet! Plus, I've always pictured myself with the wind in my hair, you know?
Yes, of course, with your helmet hair and all. I can almost write a song about the wind and a lone motorcycle, with an aura that's a mix of leather and... freedom!
Ha! "Leather and Freedom," that's a good one, Pheebs. You gotta include a line about me in there, like "Joey, the cool breeze kinda guy" or something.
I'll think about it. But, check out that fire hydrant, isn't it fascinating? It's like it's waiting for a dog to, you know... baptize it.
Phoebe, you always find the magic in mundane things. To me, it just looks like a hydrant waiting for a fire truck. Or maybe a really big dog!
Joey, everything has its own energy. Even those trees are all like, "I'm just gonna grow here and clean the air, and no one is gonna notice me." It’s very noble.
Noble, huh? Well, if that's the case, then I'm like that pizza place down the street giving out free smells to everyone passing by. That's noble and delicious!
Sure, Joey, you're as noble as a pizza place. Wow, look at the shadows on the buildings. Maybe there’s a shadow man who paints them on every day—you know, to keep things artsy.
A shadow man, huh? I wonder if shadow people get their own apartments or if they just crash at some dark alley. But hey, you think there's a shadow Joey who's like a famous actor?
Definitely. Shadow Joey probably wins all the soap opera awards and gets all the shadow girls.
That’s cool, but you know what, Phoebes? Real Joey doesn’t need awards to be happy. Just friends, food, and maybe that motorcycle from before—that would be sweet.
Yeah, and I could play my songs for you guys with my guitar as you ride around. Sounds like a dreamy day in the life of Phoebe and Joey.
You bet! But for now, how about we grab a slice of pizza and watch some "Baywatch"? We need to feed our bodies and spirits, and... you know, learn about ocean rescue.
That's a plan I can absolutely resonate with. Lead the way, spiritual pizza guide!
Oh wow, look at those vases, Joey! Aren't they just the most sophisticated pieces you've ever seen? They'd be perfect for the new collection launch.
Uh, yeah, sure, Rach. I mean, they're pretty nice vases, but, uh, where do you put the flowers? They look pretty closed off to me.

Joey, they're not meant for flowers. They're decorative! You have to appreciate the aesthetic. The way the colors transition from white to black—it's like a symbol for the fashion industry, from the classics to the bold.
Yeah, I get it! Like, uh, black and white movies moving to, you know, color TV! But personally, I like vases where I can eat the stuff after, like a candy dish... or even better, a sandwich holder!
Oh Joey, everything with you comes back to food. But imagine this: if you had an upscale acting event, wouldn't these be just the right touch of elegance?
Huh, you might be onto something, Rach. Maybe it could impress a director or something. "Hey, how you doin'? Check out my fancy vases."
Exactly! It sets a mood, Joey. It's like what I always say—fashion is about creating a feeling. And these, these create that vibe of class and artistry.
You know what, Rach? If it's about setting a mood, I totally see it. Just like how I set the mood with the right lighting before watching Baywatch. It's all about the ambiance!
Now you're getting it! But seriously, Joey, did you just compare my fashion sense to watching Baywatch?
No, no, I mean... okay maybe a little. But c'mon, you're the one who's all about the looks and I'm more about the, uh, functionality. I'm just trying to find some common ground here.
Well, thank you, Joey, for trying. Let's just agree these vases look amazing and leave it at that. Maybe you could get one for your place too. A little sophistication wouldn't hurt!
Alright, Rach. Maybe I will. And who knows, maybe a sophisticated vase is exactly what I need to finally be taken seriously as Dr. Drake Ramoray's long lost twin, Vase Man!
Okay, Joey, if you become Vase Man, I'll personally make sure one of these vases is on the set. It can be your, um, sidekick or something!
You got it! Vase Man and his sidekick... Porcelino! See what I did there? It's Italian!
Hey, Joey, take a look at this photo. I can't help but marvel at the ingenuity of early aviation engineering. That looks like a biplane from the World War I era!
Whoa! Is that one of those old-timey planes with two sets of wings? Dude, that must be like, what, the 1900-whatevers?
Actually, yes, Joey! The biplane was dominant during the World War I period, which was from 1914 to 1918. It's just fascinating to see technology that was considered state-of-the-art back then.
Bet you wouldn't catch me up in one of those! Nope. I like my feet on the ground, thank you very much.
Come on, Joey. Think about it. The thrill of being up there, feeling the wind rushing past you, the freedom... Although, statistically speaking, it was also quite hazardous.
Risky, huh? That's a no for me, Ross. And speaking of freedom, is that guy leaning on the plane trying to look as cool as I do when I'm leaning against the bar at Central Perk?
I highly doubt that's what he's going for. But you know, his pose does convey a certain nonchalance, perhaps characteristic of that era's pilot bravado.
Speaking of pilots, can you imagine if I played one in a movie? "Dr. Drake Ramoray, the daring World War I flying ace!"
You would want to be a pilot in a silent film, Joey?
Silent film... I didn't think about that. You think they'd let me do my "How you doin'?" with subtitles?
Well, it would certainly be unique. You could set a whole new trend!
Yeah! And then maybe they'd finally make that movie about me, "Joey Tribbiani: The Man, The Myth, The Legend". What do you say, Ross, think it would be a hit?
Well, your optimism is as indomitable as the spirit of those early aviators, so sure, Joey. I'd watch that.
Alright! And Ross, if that happens, you can be my advisor on all that history stuff!
I'm honored, Joey. But do promise me you'll keep your feet on the ground until then. No actual biplane stunts, okay?
Deal! Hey, let's grab some pizza and then maybe we can work on that script together. What do you say?
As long as it's historically accurate, you've got yourself a deal! Pizza and scriptwriting it is!
Oh my gosh, Joey, look at this picture. That poor little dog is wearing a coat! Isn’t that just the cutest thing?
Whoa, yeah! But Rach, why would you dress a dog like a sandwich? I mean, I love sandwiches, but that's kinda weird.
It's not a sandwich, Joey. It's a coat designed to look like a watermelon. It's got to be some kind of fashion statement for pets. Remember Princess Banana Hammock? That cat loved her outfits.
Oh right, the watermelon! Hehe, I knew that. And yeah, Phoebe’s cat! But you know what? That doesn’t look comfy. You wouldn't catch me wearing a fruit.
Joey, you once wore all of Chandler's clothes at once. I wouldn't put it past you to try a fruit suit.
Hey, that was different. That was 'cause I was proving a point. And I'll have you know, I could totally rock a fruit suit, I just... choose not to.
Of course you could, Joey. Anyway, just imagining walking down the street and seeing this – New York is never this creative with dog outfits. I bet people are smiling seeing this pup strut by.
Yeah, and you know how much I love it when people smile. But I gotta say, the best part of this whole thing is the umbrella. The dog doesn't even need it, he's got a waterproof melon coat!
That's the human's umbrella, Joey. Although, I can totally see you holding an umbrella over Ducati's head.
Definitely, Rach. No way my dog's getting wet on my watch! Plus, he'd give me that sad 'I'm so disappointed in you' look, and I couldn't handle that.
You're such a softie. Well, if you ever get a watermelon coat for him, you're heading the fashion parade, buddy.
Ha! Alright, but only if you're joining me. And by the way, speaking of fashion, should we consider this watermelon dog look for the next Ralph Lauren pet collection? I think it could be a hit!
Oh my god, Joey, no. It's cute, but seriously, my boss would probably think I've finally lost it if I suggest watermelon coats for dogs.
Well, if you change your mind, let me know. I'll be your model. I like it. What's not to like? Watermelon? Good. Dogs? Good. Coats? Good.
And that's why we love you, Joey. You and your simple, yet weirdly logical take on everything.
Oh wow, look at that, Joey! This mountain is simply majestic. Can you imagine hiking all the way up there?
Whoa! That's a lotta snow. But hiking? Rach, the only mountain I'd climb is a mountain of sandwiches. You know, like the one I made last week?

I know, Joey, your sandwiches are the stuff of legend. But just think about the view from up there! It would be absolutely breathtaking. Like that one time I went skiing with my dad, before... well, you know, when I was still a "shoe."

If you're talking about breathtaking, then yeah, climbing that mountain would pretty much take all my breath away. Literally. Also, what’s with the shoe thing? You’re more like a... really nice handbag now!
Thanks, Joey. That's sweet. But seriously, I've always wanted to travel and see places like this up close. It’s just so serene and beautiful.
Yeah, I get ya. It’s nice to look at. But if I'm travelin’, it’s gonna be to places with room service, okay? And mirrors on the ceiling. Heh!

Room service and mirrors, Joey? Really? I should have known. But we could take amazing photos up there; you could even call it research for one of your acting roles. Like, you're a rugged mountain man or something.
That's not bad, Rach! Joey Tribbiani as "The Mountain Man." I can see it now: "How you doin', bears?"
Oh no, don't start flirting with the wildlife, Joey! Haha!
Hey, I'll have you know animals love me. Except ducks. And chickens. Oh, and that one time with the penguin… Let's not talk about the penguin, huh?
Haha, okay, we'll steer clear of the penguin stories. But imagine the fresh air, the silence, just nature all around... it's like the complete opposite of New York.

Rach, you know what else is silent? Nap time. And I can do that without freezing my buns off. But you go ahead, climb mountains, make your dad proud. Or prove to him you're not a shoe or a handbag or whatever!
Maybe one day, Joey. Maybe one day we'll both go on an adventure. I'll climb the mountain, and you can relax at the base camp with a big pile of sandwiches.
Now that's a plan I can get behind! And I'll be cheering for you... from a very safe, and very warm, distance. Go, Rach!
Thanks, Joey. You're the best cheerleader a girl could ask for. Even if you do eat all the sandwiches before we even start.
Would you look at that? That's the one sport where you can fail 70% of the time and still be considered a star. Kind of like my love life before Monica.
Heh, speaking of stars, look at that batter's stance. That's how I look when I'm reaching for the last slice of pizza, only I look way cooler – and hungrier.
Yeah, and unlike baseball, in the game of pizza, stealing is definitely allowed. Especially if you're around.

Absolutely, Chandler! And remember Joey doesn't share food! But, you think these guys ever play with a meatball instead of a baseball? Because, you know, that would make the sport a whole lot tastier.
Forget the seventh-inning stretch, it would be the seventh-inning snack. Just imagine the commentator saying, "And here comes the pitch—and it's delicious!"
Now you're talkin'! But hey, you think they'd let me play? I could be like that Dr. Drake Ramoray of baseball. Smooth, charming, and I always save the game.
Sweetie, you'd save the game by eating the meatball and preventing the other team from scoring. Could you BE any more helpful?
Hey, I contribute in my own way, just like you do with your jokes. By the way, you think that catcher knows he's sitting on what could be a gold mine of nacho cheese? Just pop a chip in there and...
And, ladies and gentlemen, that's a whole new take on 'catching a snack'. If only life gave you such obvious signals, like a catcher telling you it's time to stop dating Janice.
Ouch, man! But you're right, if getting signals was as easy as playing baseball, you'd know when to run... far away from Janice's laugh.
Or knowing when to slide into a relationship without it feeling like you're being tagged out at home plate.
Home plate! Man, why couldn't we be talking about home plates full of spaghetti and meatballs? Baseball, it's all about the food metaphors for me.
Well, pal, next time there's a game, we'll just bring a picnic. You focusing on the food, and me dodging any sports-related responsibilities... It'll be perfection.
Look at that tiny human interacting with technology. It's like he's ready to start his own blog or something. Do you think babies have their own secret internet, Joey?
Haha, Phoebs, that's hilarious! But nah, if they did have one, it'd probably just be pictures of boobs and formulas all over the place.
True, but what if he's, like, a genius baby and is actually coding his first app? I mean, look at his concentration; he's definitely up to something.
Maybe he's ordering a pizza! That's what I'd do if I could use a computer when I was a baby!
Or he's writing a strongly worded letter to Santa because he got a rattle instead of the latest smartphone for Christmas.
He’s probably just watching cartoons, but imagine if he's actually given up on the cartoons 'cause they've become too predictable. You know, maybe babies need more plot twists.
For sure! Like maybe the stork brings the wrong baby, and it turns out, it's actually a little kangaroo. I'd watch that show.
Hey, don't give away your brilliant ideas for free, Phoebs! We could totally pitch that to a network. Joey and Phoebe's Baby Kangaroo Adventure Hour!
Oh my God, yes! And we could sing the theme song! "Kangaroo Baby, hopping through the city, solving baby mysteries without any pity!"
Perfect! And I could be the voice of the wise-cracking parrot sidekick who's always getting into the baby food!
This is gold, Joey! Now, let's hope that baby has us in mind for his first big investment with his baby internet empire.
Look at this, Joey. All three traffic lights are lit at the same time. Isn’t that completely bizarre?
Whoa, dude! That’s like Christmas but for cars! They must be so confused, like, "Do I go? Do I stop? Do I celebrate?"
Yeah, it must be a malfunction. But imagine the chaos it could cause. There should be fail-safes to prevent this.
Fail-safes? Ross, this isn’t some dinosaur bone you can just glue back together if it breaks. It's high-tech stuff!
Well, actually, in the world of technology and traffic systems...
Uh-oh, here comes Professor Geller! Everybody, take your seats! Class is in session!
Very funny, but this could be a serious safety issue. Think about the implications on traffic patterns and the potential accidents.
Yeah, I get it, Ross. But check out that snow, huh? Looks like it's piling up pretty fast. You think we're gonna have a white New York Christmas this year?
I sure hope so. Ben loves building snowmen, and it'd be great for Emma's first real Christmas experience.
Can we build the world's largest sandwich out of snow? Oh! We could call it the "Frosty Joey Special"!
I'm not sure that'd be very appetizing, but I'm in for building it with you. As long as there's no actual meat involved.
Deal! But I’m still keeping my real sandwiches to myself. Remember, Joey doesn't share food! Not even with snowmen.
I wouldn’t dream of taking food away from you, Joey. Just make sure you don’t try to eat the snow sandwich.
Hey, snow might not taste like much but with enough imagination it can be anything. Even pizza!
Let's stick to making it look like a pizza, okay? Anyway, I really should report that light situation. It's not exactly 'unagi'.
'unagi'. Ross, I still don't think that means what you think it means. But yeah, go be the hero and report the lights!
At least I can be sure I'm doing something constructive. Just promise me you won't go out and try to direct traffic, Joey.
No promises, Ross! Could be my big chance to land a role as a traffic cop. "How you doin', fellow drivers?"
I suppose I should just be grateful that you're not 'acting' as a paleontologist... There can only be one Dr. Geller.
And he's the one looking out for all of us. Alright, go do your thing. Just make it quick, 'cause you're helping me with that snow sandwich later!
You got it, Joey. Just make sure to dress warmly, alright? It's a 'snow joke' out there.
Oh man, Ross, that was bad even for you!
Oh wow, look at this, Joey! Don't you think the whole concept of air travel is fascinating? All these people going to different places, each with their own stories.
Yeah, it's amazing! And you know what else is amazing? Airplane food! I mean, tiny little meals served way up high in the sky – it's like a flying restaurant!
Oh my God, Joey, only you would get this excited about food on an airplane. But look at the precision and organization on the tarmac. It's all Monica clean!
Heh, it better be! You don’t want to be tripping over luggage on the runway. Wait, is that a Virgin Australia plane?

Yes, Joey, good eye! And see that blue one over there? That's a Southwest plane. This is like a ballet of aviation—each plane has its spot and timing to follow. It’s all about coordination, like in my kitchen!
Speaking of ballet, remember when I tried to learn to dance for that play and ended up doing the 'Funky Chicken' instead of ballet? Good times!

Yes, Joey, I remember. You dancing ballet is an image permanently engraved in my mind. But, look at those airplanes, patiently queued up for takeoff. It kind of reminds me of us waiting for a table at a restaurant.

I don’t do queues, Mon! Remember my motto – "Joey doesn’t share food", and that includes my spot in the line if it's for food. But you're right. Everything's gotta be in order, like actors waiting for their cue to go on stage.
Definitely organized. This view makes you really consider what a crazy world we live in, huh? All these people traveling from one place to the next. It’s like a huge, living organism.
Yeah, and think about this. Maybe there's someone like Dr. Drake Ramoray on one of those planes, going to his next big adventure.
Joey, you and your soap opera world! But who knows, there might be a famous chef on one of those planes too, maybe even going to their own cooking show.
As long as they bring me back some of that airplane food, I'm fine with that. Hey, do airplanes have pizzas?
Joey. There's more to life than pizza. But yes, some airplanes do serve pizza. Maybe not as good as I could make though.
Nothing beats your pizza, Mon! Well, except for a sandwich. A sandwich would totally beat a pizza...
And that's my cue to go make lunch before you eat the entire contents of my fridge.
Now that's a plan I'm totally on board with!
Oh my god, look at this, Joey. This almost looks like one of those healthy smoothies I tried to make last week, remember? Except, mine wasn't that... appetizing.
Yeah, I remember. Yours looked kinda like swamp water, no offense. But hey, what's with the single banana just sitting there? It's like it's on a timeout or something.
You! It's probably there for scale or, you know, to show what's in the smoothie. It's sort of like when I organize a display at work—you have to make it look appealing.
If ya say so. But honestly, I don't get why people put perfectly good food in a blender when they could just, you know, eat it.
It's for convenience, Joey; it's like eating and drinking at the same time. Plus, it can be a time-saver in the morning.
Time-saver, huh? Well, could save more time by not doing it at all. Just grab a pizza slice on the way out—breakfast, done!
That's so unhealthy! Joey, I'm telling you, these smoothies give you energy, they're good for your skin, they're...
Rachel, Rachel... does it have meat?
No, Joey, it doesn't have meat. It's a fruit smoothie.

Then what's the point? Look, Rach, you're talking to a guy who's seen a sandwich bring people back from the dead. Fruit's great and all, but it's just the opening act, you know? Where's the main course?
Okay, Dr. Tribbiani, I'll remember to consult you next time I'm planning a menu. Just promise me you'll try one of these smoothies someday. Who knows, you might actually find you like it.
All right, all right, if you make it, I'll try it. But only if you sit down and eat a whole sandwich with me afterward—deal?
Deal. But I'm making a lean turkey sandwich, okay? No meat sweats on my watch.
Turkey's technically meat, so I'll take it. You've got yourself a deal, Rach.
Look at these zebras, Joey! They're so, like, free and untamed. Don't you just feel their spirit calling to you?
Uh, Phoebe, I hate to break it to you, but I think those might be, uh, not real.
Yeah, sure, and next you're going to tell me that unicorns aren't real. Joey, we're in the presence of majestic creatures, and they could be magical zebras for all we know.
Phoebe, they're not moving. And look, that guy is literally holding one up with a pole.
Well, maybe they're just really well-trained? Or maybe, they're on a zebra strike for better savannah rights!
A zebra strike, huh? Now that would be a first. Although, come to think of it, if there are zebra unions, I’d definitely support them. Equal grazing rights for all!
Right? And oh my gosh, Joey, they're so fashion-forward. This whole black and white thing – it's a statement. It's like they're the Coco Chanel of the animal kingdom.
Ha! They do dress pretty sharp. But I gotta say, Phoebs, the black and white thing is a bit much for me. I mean, not even a little color? It’s like, come on, how about a red hat or something?
Oh no, Joey. You can't go around accessorizing wild animals, it would disrupt their aura. Plus, I don't think a hat would stay on very long during those wild zebra chases.
You got a point. But those wild chases would definitely be more stylish, you know? Imagine a zebra running in a tiny fedora!
You're adorable, Joey. Hey, we should totally write a song about these zebras. Something like "Stylish Zebra, won't you come and play, down the fashion runway of nature’s grand café."
I’m not much of a songwriter, Phoebs, but I could be your manager! We'll take these zebras right to the top of the charts!
Deal. And every ticket sold helps real zebras get more stripes or, like, whatever it is they need.
As long as they don't need to share any food, I'm in. Can we get some pizza after this? I'm starved.
Sure. But only if we can find an all-veggie one. I'm not having anything that had a face.
Deal. Veggie pizza, no sharing, and a song about zebras. Phoebs, this is going to be one wild day.
So, check out this image. It's a UK flag on the tail… British Airways, I presume? Could we BE any more international right now?
Oh man, yeah! That's one of those big planes. You think they have free pizza on international flights? 'Cause I could totally go for a pizza slice the size of a jet engine right now.

Well, if anything were to be served that large, I'm sure it’d be reserved for first class. You know, where the seats are so big even the turkeys from our Thanksgiving could sit comfortably – and have room for dessert.
Dude, I'd fly first class every day if they had seats like that. Hey, didn't you use to have a fear of flying?
Yep, but therapy and an intense reliance on sarcasm got me through. Just imagine me, up there with all that sky around, talking to the clouds – "Could you BE any fluffier?"
That could definitely be a way to pass time on a long flight. You know what they should have though? In-flight foosball. That'd be awesome!
With your competitive streak, we'd have an emergency landing in no time. Captain speaking: “Ladies and gentlemen, please fasten your seatbelts, Joey’s just scored a goal and we’ve lost altitude.”
Hey, if that were the case, I’d make sure to do my victory dance in the aisle!
And that, my friend, is how we'd get banned from British Airways for life. But on the bright side, we wouldn't have to argue about who gets the window seat.
Hey, Joey, check this out! Can you believe the manner in which these elephants are just submerging themselves in the water? Such magnificent creatures!
Oh yeah, Ross. It's like they're having a pool party, and nobody brought the beer!

You know, elephants are incredibly social animals. They have strong family bonds, much like us humans. The way they interact within their herds is truly fascinating from a sociobiological perspective.
Social, huh? Guess they wouldn't just ditch their friends for a date. Unlike some people...
Come on, Joey. Are we still on that? I told you, it was a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to meet a Nobel Prize-winning paleontologist. I had to take it!
I know, I know. It's just, you missed out on pizza night! And you know how much I love pizza. It's like, pizza? Good. Friends? Good. Pizza with friends? Gooood.
Sorry, Joey. How about next time, we order an extra-large pizza, and I promise not to bring up any dinosaur facts. That way, you can eat and I can enjoy the silence.
Deal! But back to the elephants, look at the little one! He's all like, "Hey, I'm walking here!" So cute!

That would be a calf, Joey. Probably learning to use its trunk to breathe while submerged. It's all part of their development process. Plus, they use water to cool down, protect their skin from the sun, and play. Bath time is pretty essential for an elephant.
Whoa, if taking a bath is that much fun, maybe I should try it more often, huh?
There's a concept. Hey, did you notice the tusks on the larger one there? Tusks are actually elongated incisor teeth and they continue to grow throughout an elephant's life. Fascinating!
Yeah, tusks... good for fighting, right? Or is it like in hockey, for intimidation?
Well, they can be used for defense, but primarily for foraging. They dig for water or minerals, debark trees, and move things around. They're versatile tools, really.
Like a Swiss Army knife, but for elephants! That'd be cool to have – a Swiss Army trunk!
Only you could make an elephant's survival mechanism sound like a gadget, Joey.
You gotta admit, it's kinda cool. But seriously, Ross, if you ever feel like sharing more dino facts, I'm your guy. Just as long as we can also talk about sandwiches and girls.
It's a deal, my friend. Now come on, we've got an extra-large pizza with our names on it waiting for us.
So, I guess this is what people used before they could ignore each other with smartphones.
Hey, is that one of those old-school folding phones? That thing is ancient!
It's like looking at a dinosaur skeleton. Could it BE any more outdated?
But you know, back in the day, that was top-of-the-line. Like... like the sandwich of phones!
And now it's just... not even a side salad. Y'know, if this phone had a career, it'd be like yours.
Hey! My career is not outdated, it's just... vintage. Like a classic car, ready to make a comeback.
Yeah, and this phone could be your manager. You could call all two of your fan clubs without dropping the call.
Look who's talking! At least I don't have to worry about my phone getting a more exciting job than me!
Burn! But seriously, if this phone can snag a junior copywriter position, let me know. I could use the competition.
Ha! You really think that thing could take your job?
Well, it probably has better skills at turning on than I do.
Dude, you're telling me! Remember when you tried to impress Monica with that "sexy" dance?
Let's not revisit that dark, dark place... Anyway, imagine if we had to tweet with this phone. Do you think you could tell the world 'How you doin'?' in 160 characters or less?
Chandler, for your information, my catchphrase is timeless. It'd be trending no matter what phone I use.
Now I can picture it: "Joey Tribbiani, bringing 'moo' points back one flip phone at a time."
Exactly! And, hey, if flip phones come back, we can always say we were ahead of the curve.
Or more likely, trapped in a technological time warp. Just imagine downloading using this phone. It would be faster to actually draw the information you wanted.
You gotta admit, though, there's something kinda cool about it. It's like... comfort food, but for tech.
Comfort food? This phone is more like the mystery meatloaf of tech. You're not quite sure what's inside, but you eat it anyway because, well, it's food.
Well, I'd eat it. I'm not picky with my meatloaf... or my tech.
And that, my friend, is why you're Joey Tribbiani – the only guy who could make tech feel like a home-cooked meal.
Look at this guy. Do you think he's talking to the Earth spirits or maybe getting takeout from another dimension?
Huh? Pheebs, what are you talking about? He's just on his phone. Probably ordering a pizza. Mmm... pizza.
No, Joey, he's clearly not in New York. Maybe he's ordering one of those, you know, exotic sandwiches, like the kind with sprouts and mystery sauce.
Exotic sandwiches? Why would you ruin a perfectly good sandwich with... sprouts? Anyway, he looks serious, like maybe he's talking business. Maybe he's a sandwich businessman!
That's possible. Or maybe he's a poet, speaking in sonnets to his muse! Like, "O Cell Phone, O Cell Phone, wherefore art thou reception?"

Sonnets? I don't think sonnets involve reception, Phoebe. But hey, maybe he's an actor getting the call for his big break! Like I got for Dr. Drake Ramoray! Except I hope his character doesn't fall down an elevator shaft...
If he's an actor, I hope he's calling his agent to thank them for not casting that snooty Ursula in his play. She wouldn't even need to act!
Hey, looking at this guy makes me think. Maybe we should learn how to farm, you know? Fresh food right from the source! I could grow my own sandwich ingredients!
Joey, I could totally see you as a farmer. You'd be out there, talking to the tomatoes, asking them, "How you doin'?" before you eat them.
I would be good at it! And if any veggies don't grow well, I'd just tell them, "You are so far past the line, the line is a dot to you!" Ha!
Joey, your passion for food is almost poetic. Like a dance between a man and his sandwich, each bite an act of love.
That's the most beautiful thing I've ever heard about food, Pheebs. You sure you're not the poet?
Look, Joey! This scene feels like Mother Nature just said, "let's chill." Doesn't it give you this peaceful, easy feeling?
Totally! It's like, the water is so calm, it's like it's not even trying. No waves, no ripples, nothing. Nature's just kickin' back taking a break.
I bet there are magical creatures living in that mountain. You know, hiding just beyond the mist. Ooh, maybe a yeti or something.
A yeti, huh? You think he's up there, maybe watching TV and eating a sandwich? 'Cause, you know, that's what I'd do if I lived in a cool foggy mountain.
No, Joey. Yetis are more into, like, ice sculptures and contemplating the mysteries of the universe. Although, a sandwich does sound good in any dimension.
I'm telling you, Phoebs, if there were restaurants with views like this, I'd become a restaurant critic. "The scenery: five stars. The sandwich: needs more meat."
And I'd write songs about the lonely boats just waiting for their sailors. "Lonely Boat, Lonely Boat, what are they not fishing you?"
That's not bad, Phoebs! But don't you think boats get lonely? They're always in pairs or groups. Look, those two gotta be buddies.
Yeah, they're like you and Chandler. Just floating together, weathering the storms. Except with less fighting over the remote.
And way less foosball. Hey, what if one boat says to the other, "Could I BE tied any closer to you?"

My goddess, that's funny 'cause it's like that guy, Chandler, says. But seriously, check out that mountain with the cloud hat. It's like it's trying to tell us a secret. Maybe about the meaning of life... or the best way to row without getting blisters.
You think the meaning of life is in there? Because, Phoebe, I'd climb a mountain for it. As long as there's like, a pizza place along the way.
Certainly, the promise of pizza is its own kind of spiritual experience. But let's be real - you'd get up there and shout, "How you doin', sacred mountain spirits?"
Probably, but can you imagine the echo? "How you doin'... doin'... doin'?" Man, I could totally go for a mountain echo right about now.
It does sound like a fun way to pass the time. Plus, the spirits might just answer you back. "We're good, Joey... Joey... Joey."
That's the spirit, Phoebs! And hey, if the spirits need a good laugh, they know who to call.
Oh my God, Joey, look at that! These kids are playing soccer just like Ross tried to teach Emma last weekend.
Oh yeah? How'd that go?
Let's just say... she inherited her mother's skills at sports.
Ouch! You mean she kicked the ball into the other team's goal? 'Cause I gotta tell ya, I did that once. I was the hero for the wrong team!
Exactly! But look at them, they're so into the game. It's cute, isn't it? I bet Ross would have loved to see Emma out there.
Ha! Can you imagine? With Ross all competitive and yelling instructions. "Pivot! Pivot!"
That's true. Oh, and there's always that one kid who's just running in the wrong direction.
Yeah, I kinda feel for that kid. I mean, that was me in peewee football. Except, I was chasing the hot dog guy.
Of course, you were. Joey Tribbiani, always thinking with his stomach. But really, it's great for kids this age to start playing sports, don’t you think?
Absolutely! It's all about teamwork and, you know, the snacks after the game. Plus, they get to run around a lot, which means they'll nap later. Win-win!
True. Remember when we all played that game of football on Thanksgiving?
How could I forget? I was amazing! The 'Joey Special' won us the game!
Right, your infamous block. Well, at least until Monica's "I'm so much littler than you" tactic.
Hey, if it gets too rough for this Emma, I can jump in and be her body double. I still got some moves!
Oh really, Joey? I would pay good money to see that.
Guess what? For you, I'll do it for free. The kids will love Uncle Joey – as long as Uncle Joey doesn’t have to share his post-game pizza!
Deal! But let's stick to soccer with the kids, huh? I don’t think we can handle another 'Joey doesn't share food' episode.
Hey, I've grown! I might let them have a slice... as long as they don't touch my meatball sub.
Oh my gosh, Joey, look at this! Isn't this elephant just absolutely majestic?
Whoa! That's like the supermodel of the elephant world. So, uh, what's it doing?
It looks like it's having a blast in the water, doesn't it? I swear it almost makes me want to throw on a bathing suit and join in.
Haha, yeah! Hey, it's like the time I tried to do that synchronized swimming scene for that audition, remember? Except, you know, more graceful.
I remember. You splashing around was the exact opposite of this. No offense, Joey.
None taken. But hey, can you imagine the size of the sandwich that guy must need after a swim like that? I mean, I get hungry after a few laps, so that guy... Must be a whole loaf of bread situation.
A whole loaf? Joey, it would probably be more like a whole bakery. Just for the record, not everything is about food.
Heh, everything's better with food, Rach. But seriously, look at the energy! Think it knows some good elephant dance moves?
Dance moves? You'd probably want to sign it up for "So You Think You Can Trunk Swing", wouldn't you?
Absolutely! Hey, if Marcel could land a role in a movie, this elephant could definitely rock a dance floor.
You might be onto something, but then again, you did believe you could teach a dog to moo...
Hey, that's a moo point, Rach. The important thing here is, that elephant is having the time of its life. And it doesn't even need to know how to dance, or moo, for that matter.
Touché, Joey. It's just living its best life, huh? Something we could all learn from, I guess.
Yeah, next time we all hit the beach, I'm doing that - I'll be the Joeyphant! Splashing around, carefree... but, uh, maybe with a little more sunscreen than usual.
I would pay good money to see that, Joey. Just, please don't try to eat a sandwich while you're at it.
Oh hey, Joey, check this out. You think this is related to the president Truman?
Whoa, which one? We've had like, a ton of presidents, right?

Well, yes, but I'm talking about Harry S. Truman, the 33rd president. Remember? I mean, it's W. Truman Road, so it does make you wonder if there's any historical significance or whether it’s just a namesake.
Right, right, Harry. Maybe he walked down this road and they were like, 'Let's name it after him!' That would be cool, huh?

Actually, Joey, it's not quite how it works. It’s more likely named to honor the president rather than due to a casual stroll. Public roads, buildings, and such are often named to commemorate notable figures. Still, it's fascinating to ponder the history behind these decisions.
Man, Ross, you always know this kind of stuff. It's like you got a map of fun facts in your head! So, what about Delaware Ave? You got any trivia on that one?
Delaware, the first state to ratify the Constitution. It's known as the "First State", Joey. Again, it's common for places to get names that reflect parts of history or promote a sense of heritage.
The first state, huh? I'll remember that the next time I play trivia. If that's a question, we're definitely gonna win, Ross!

Absolutely, we'd make a great team! Always good to have a few historical gems up your sleeve for those moments. Now, if only "W. Truman Road" had a signpost about dinosaurs, that'd be perfect for me, ha!
Yeah! And if Delaware Ave sold sandwiches, I'd be set. We should make our own road with dinosaurs and sandwiches, Ross!
That's quite the idea, Joey. Dinosaurs and sandwiches, a road trip destination made in heaven. Maybe throw in a basketball hoop for good measure?
You got it, Ross! And we can call it... T-Rex Wraps and Hoops Ave! How you doin', road name? Ha!
So, I guess they've started valet parking for horse-drawn carriages now.
What? Where? I want to see this!
Right there, Joey. Although, to be fair, it's less valet parking and more... standing still with an air of equine indifference.
Hey, do you think the horse gets bored just standing there? I mean, if I was a horse in the city, I'd want to see a Broadway show or something.
I'm sure right now he's just dreaming of running through the fields, wind in his mane, thinking, "Could I BE any more constrained by this urban environment?"
Maybe he's waiting for a carriage that's just his style. Y'know, like how I wait for a pizza that speaks to me.
Yes, because that's the same thing. If that horse turns around and decides to order a large pepperoni, I'm moving to the country.
You think horses have favorite foods? Like, what if this horse doesn’t share food either? He and I could be like spirit animals!
I'm not sure if horses ponder their food-sharing policies, but if they did, you two would definitely be in the same stable of stubbornness.
So, I'm looking at this image, and you know what it's missing?
I know this one. A hot dog stand, right?
No, but good guess. It's missing… us! Could we BE any more absent from this tranquil riverside scene?
Yeah, and look at that dude jogging. That's something we would never do, right?
Absolutely. The only time you'll see me running is if they're giving out free cheesecakes at the end of the race. And even then, I'd probably walk.
Speak for yourself, man. I'd jog for cheesecake. Wait… Is that a little dog there?
Where? Oh, yes. It's like the canine version of you—small, eager, and likely to get overly excited at the first sight of food.
Hey! I am not small!
Relatively. In the world of sumo wrestlers, you are but a mere child.
Fine, but in the dog world, I'd be the Great Dane, because, you know, I'm the alpha dog.
Of course you are, Lassie. Anyway, check out that couple walking by the water. That could be you and me—walkin', talkin', falafel in hand…
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold up. First off, you're married to Monica, remember? And second, I don't share food, even if it's a beautiful moment by the river.
Well, I stand corrected. That's a scenario too unrealistic even for us.
You got that right. But you know, it is a nice place. Maybe we could hang out there sometime? You know, do some people-watching, relax.
Sure, as long as we make up a game with rules that involve snacking each time someone says 'river'. I could be into that.
I'm in! But I'm bringing my own snacks. Remember, Joey doesn't share food!
Wouldn't dream of taking food from you, Joseph. That would be scarier than accidentally hearing one of my dad's romantic escapades.
Oh man, you crack me up! Alright, let's plan that day by the river. We'll get some sun, you'll make sarcastic comments, and I'll keep an eye out for that hot dog stand. It's gotta be there somewhere.
It's a date. And by date, I mean in the calendar sense, not the romance sense. Because, you know... I'm hopeless and awkward and desperate for love!
You're not desperate for love, you've got Monica! And she loves you even with all the sarcasm.
Right, because with me, sarcasm is an always-on service. Now, shall we go find that river view in real life? I promise, no running required.
Let's do it! But after lunch, okay? Because you know what they say: never walk on an empty stomach.
I don't think anyone says that, Joe.
They should!
Look Joey, it’s like the big metal birds are having a meeting. Do you think they're planning a trip somewhere exotic?
Heh, maybe they’re going to that place where they have that pizza with the really tiny fish on it. What’s it called?
You mean Sicily with the anchovies? But, you know, I think the planes are more spiritual than that. They might be discussing their dreams and the places they've seen.
Oh! I get it. Like when I talk to my sandwich before I eat it. “You’re going on a very important journey... to my stomach!”
Exactly, Joey! Though sandwiches and planes are slightly different. Each of these planes carries hundreds of people's hopes and dreams up into the clouds. It's very celestial.
Speaking of which, do you think you could ever date a pilot? I mean, they've gotta be pretty cool, flying all over the place, right?
Hm, I dunno. Pilots are too grounded for me. I need someone more... terrestrial. Someone who understands my songs.
Phoebs, I think grounded is the opposite of what pilots are...
Well, you know what I mean. I need somebody with their head in the clouds but their feet on the ground. Oh, I could write a song about that!
And I'll be the first to listen, as long as it’s not another 'Smelly Cat'. No offense, but how does that even happen to a cat?
It's a metaphor, Joey. A metaphor for the stinky parts of society that nobody wants to admit exist.
Okay. Hey, Phoebs, can planes have stinky parts too? Because one time, Chandler and I flew to Vegas, and it did NOT smell good.
Well, it could be. Or maybe that was just Chandler. Anyway, look at the one with the red tail. I feel like she's the leader, the one with all the flight wisdom.
Flight wisdom, huh? Is that like street smarts, but for the sky?
You could say that. She's seen things from above; she knows about the wind and the stars. I bet she has some incredible stories.
I bet she does. Maybe next time I fly, I'll try talking to the plane. You think it'll help me get to my audition in LA faster?
It couldn't hurt, Joey. And hey, if you listen closely, the plane might just share its wisdom with you.
Cool. I'll be like, "How you flyin'?" instead of "How you doin'?" They'll love me!
They definitely will, Joey. Planes need friends too.
Look at that, Joey. Sweet circular confections of the universe. I feel like they're little tasty orbs imparting wisdom with every bite.
Orbs of wisdom, huh? I always thought of donuts as, you know, sugary wheels of happiness. And that coffee looks perfect for dipping, don't you think?
True, but don't you sense there's something more spiritual about them? Like, they could be meditative rings that monks in the Himalayas ponder over?
I don't know about monks, but if pondering means eating, then I'm basically a doughnut monk. Namaste, right?
Namaste indeed. Remember when we tried to do that juice cleanse and you lasted, oh, a grand total of four hours?
Hey! It was six hours, thank you very much. And it was only because someone brought a pizza into the apartment. It’s like bringing sand to the beach, Phoebe. Unfair!
You’re right. I can imagine your epitaph now, 'Joey Tribbiani, devoted to pizza and donuts, he never shared food.'

Hey, I'd be proud of that. But you know, Pheebs, looking at that half-eaten doughnut makes me think... Why would anyone leave half? It's like, half a heart, half a soul, half a Joey never feels whole.

That’s so… profound. Like my "Smelly Cat" but for doughnuts. Maybe its other half found its way to help someone else fulfill their doughnut destiny. They're out there becoming whole with someone else's belly.
Like a doughnut matchmaker! That's beautiful, Pheebs. But seriously, we should probably rescue the other half before it gets lonely.
Indeed, Joey. We are but humble heroes in the plight of the lonely pastry. Let's save it with coffee and fill the emptiness with creamy goodness.
Now you're talkin' my language! And just to pay respects to the doughnut monks, we'll meditate on each bite, sound good?
Perfect. It's like a sacred snack ritual—Phoebe and Joey's Order of the Divine Donut Dip.
Divine Donut Dip, I like that! And as the first rule of our new order, I say no half-donuts ever get left behind.
Agreed, partner in pastry. Agreed.

Oh my God, Joey, look at this image! It's like a scene from the kitty version of The Sopranos. Look at the boss cat up there on the couch, just watching all the action. Do you think he's planning something sinister or maybe overseeing his furry empire?

Whoa, yeah! That big cat's totally giving off a "Don Catleone" vibe. And hey, check out the other one, down there on the floor. He looks like he's sneakin' around—maybe he's on a secret mission or something, huh?

Absolutely! And it seems like there's a standoff happening over that little red heart. Maybe it's a love triangle, or possibly it's a rite of passage to join the "Cosa Nostra." You know, kind of a test of loyalty for the newcomers of the clowder.
Pheebs, clowder? What's that, like chowder for cats or something?
No, silly! It's what a group of cats is called. Like a murder of crows or a Joey of sandwiches.
Hey, I would totally watch that—The Adventures of Joey and his Sandwiches. But back to the cats, you think the one that's flying is like a spy or maybe the enforcer?
Definitely an enforcer. But look how gracefully he's just leaping through the air. He's like a... a furry ballerina of death. Very stealthy, very sly.
Ballerina... death... got it. So, Phoebs, do ya think these cats are, like, practicing their battle moves for the big showdown with the dogs next door?
Most likely. It's the turf wars in the animal kingdom. And did you notice all the toys scattered around? It's their war zone. I'm sure there's a lot of history on this battlefield.
Yeah! It's like a kid's room after a playdate. Except, you know, no kids, just ninja cats. And speaking of history, I bet each toy represents a conquest, a triumph from past battles. Like trophies.
Precisely! Speaking of toys, what do you think about the fish on a string? Perhaps it's bait or a secret weapon?
Could be. Or maybe it's just lunch. You know, I respect a cat that can multitask—preparing for war and a meal at the same time. That's efficiency, Phoebe, that's efficiency.
So true. Joey, maybe in another life you were a cat—regal, well-fed, and with the uncanny ability to nap anywhere, anytime.

I like that. But I gotta say, I wouldn’t mind sharing food if it means a nice, tasty fish. Anyway, I bet the flying one lands it, grabs the red heart, and becomes the hero of the day. What do you think?
Absolutely! It's like they say, all is fair in love and clowder wars. Now if only there was a 'Smelly Cat' among them, my day would be made.
So, Joey, does this gourmet feast remind you of the Thanksgiving dinners we never had at my place?
Oh man, it looks delicious! But where's the turkey, huh? A Thanksgiving meal's not complete without a turkey. You know, like the one I got stuck on my head?
Yes, because who can forget the image of a poultry-wearing Joey? But look at this, they have shrimp. Shrimp at Thanksgiving! Could this BE any more untraditional?
Shrimp, turkey, whatever! As long as there's food on the table, it's all good. But hey, Chandler, do you think this stuff is better than the Moist Maker?

I don’t know, Joey. The Moist Maker is a sandwich worth stealing from your coworker and then lying about. This looks like, I don't know, something you'd eat with a queen. Which for you means more shrimp and less dignity.
Hey, I can be dignified! Remember when I wore Chandler clothes? Could I BE wearing any more clothes?

Yes, Joey, because nothing says dignified like doing lunges in a room full of my entire wardrobe. But let’s get back to the matter at hand – look at this little dish. Is that... is that jam next to the shrimp?
Whoa! Jam! Good. Shrimp! Good. Put them together, and what do you got? ...I’m thinking, maybe it’s not a great idea after all.
Right, because jam with shrimp is a cooking disaster even you wouldn't dare try. And that's saying something, considering your legendary meat trifle.
Hey, my trifle was good! Maybe this jam thing is a new taste sensation, like dipping your fries in a milkshake.
Okay, you know what? Let's just stick to the basics. No trifle or fry-shake disasters today. This food here, it's practically art.
Art, huh? Well, I could stare at this all day, but I'd rather eat it! How about we dig in before I start having 'Artistic differences' with my stomach?
Alright, Picasso, grab your fork. But don't even think about using my shirt as a napkin this time.
Look at this guy riding the wave. Could he BE any more balanced?
I know! He's like the surfer version of Dr. Drake Ramoray, cool under pressure. Except, you know, not in a coma.
And no evil twin trying to steal his life. You know, if surfing was a part of our soap opera lives, my character would probably be the one getting hit by the surfboard.
Yeah, and then I’d have to perform some kind of brain surgery on the beach. "Scalpel! Sunscreen! A bandana!"
"I'm sorry, but he's got a severe case of... gnarly wipeout-itis."
"And I'm afraid it's... totally tubular." But seriously, look at the focus on that guy's face. That's like me when I'm about to bite into a meatball sub.
If only you showed that much dedication to learning your lines.

Hey, I learn my lines! It just... takes a few... umm... read-throughs. And look at that water, huh? Remember the time you tried to make Thanksgiving dinner and flooded the apartment? The kitchen looked like a mini version of this wave.
