Why don't we stick to talking about surfing? My culinary disasters are no longer admissible evidence. It seems like every time we get near water, things go awry. Remember the beach trip?
How could I forget? You got stung by a jellyfish, and then I had to step up to be your hero. That's right, ladies and gents, who needs Baywatch when you've got Joey Tribbiani on the ocean patrol?
You never miss a chance to bring that up, do you? But sure, go ahead, take all the glory while I retain the dignity of someone who's been... jellyfished.
Come on, you know if it wasn’t for me... Okay, okay, I won't say it. But you gotta admit, we always have the best stories to tell after our adventures, even the ones that involve pee.

Yep, nothing says "bonding" like urinary tract discussions. And speaking of things that 'go', I should probably go do... something productive. btnSave the image for the next time we need a laugh, though. I bet it'll be a 'wave' of nostalgia.
Aha, good one! Alright, buddy, catch ya later. And maybe, just maybe, we should take a surfing lesson one day. You know, embrace the wipeouts!
I'll leave the wipeouts to the professionals and the fictional doctors. You in for pizza later?
Is that even a question? You had me at "pizza."
Would you look at that, Joey? Those suitcases are just left there with clothes all over. It's kind of driving me nuts. How hard is it to fold your clothes and put them away?
I dunno, Mon. Maybe they were in a hurry? Or maybe it's an art thing, like a statement about the chaos of travel or something.

A statement? Joey, unpacked luggage is not a statement; it's a mess waiting to be organized! I can't believe no one's dealing with it. It's like someone started packing or unpacking and just... abandoned ship.
Yeah, but look at it this way – the colors are kind of nice together, right? Like, those purples against the wallpaper, it's got a vibe!
A vibe? Joey, who cares about the vibe when there's a lack of organization? But you're right, the colors do match... It's still messy, though.
C'mon Mon, don't you ever just throw your clothes on the bed and say, 'I'll deal with it later'? Oh wait, this is you we're talking about – Miss '"Not just clean, Monica clean."'

Joey, Joey, Joey. The day I leave my clothes strewn about will be the day you turn down a sandwich. Speaking of which, those patterns on the suitcase fabric kind of remind me of a quilt my grandma used to have. Oh, if only I could straighten up a bit...
Relax, will ya? Hey, maybe they left it like this to find everything easier. You know, the 'organized chaos' method?
Organized chaos? Is that your excuse for your room, too?
It's not an excuse if it works, Mon. And hey, sometimes I like to think of my room as 'laid-back chic.' It's a thing, I swear!

Laid-back chic… Right, and I'm the Queen of England. Okay, I'll make you a bet – if there's a single thing in there that's actually folded, I will let you have the last piece of lasagna in the fridge.
Oh! It's on! But if it's all messy, you've got to eat a sandwich I make...and I get creative with my fillings, you know that, right?
Maybe I should have thought this through... But fine, it's a deal! Now let's take a closer look, shall we?
Look Joey, this feels like something straight out of a Pottery Barn catalog, doesn't it?
Yeah, but where's the giant ceramic dog, huh? Every living room should have one.
Oh my God, you're right. And where's the entertainment unit? You can't just have a TV floating there without the essence of wood surrounding it.
Maybe they just like... more space for activities or something. Y'know, like karate.
That would be a very serene place to practice karate indeed. But Joey, look at those flowers. There's something about them that is weirdly familiar.
Oh! Maybe they're from that flower shop you love, the one with the psychic florist who said I'd be famous one day.
Yes! That's probably it because I sense a very strong aura from them. It's like they're saying, "Hello Phoebe, remember us?"
If flowers started talking to me, I'd be out of that room faster than you can say "sandwich."
Joey, always bringing it back to food. But, on that note, I don't see a dining table. Where would you eat your sandwiches?
This is a serious problem. A man's gotta have a place to eat his sandwiches. Maybe it's one of those fancy invisible ones, like the emperor's new clothes.
Invisible dining tables? That's the kind of furniture I can get behind. It's like Schrödinger's table; it's both there and not there until you observe it, or in your case, eat off it.
Phoebs, you're getting all metaphysical on me again. But hey, as long as the sandwiches are real, I'm good.
They're real, Joey. The sandwiches are always real.
Oh my God, Joey, look at this image. If that's not a blast from the past, I don't know what is! A flip phone! Remember when we all had those?
Whoa! Look at that tiny thing! And hey, isn't that like one of the suits I wore for an audition once? The role was a high-flying stockbroker, but all I really did was lose all of Monica's savings...
Yes, the one where you ended up investing in some sort of, uh, ‘WENUS-enhancing’ stock? It was certainly a look, Joey. But I've got to say, this guy's got nothing on you style-wise.
Thanks, Rach! And for the record, that stock could've taken off! Anyway, flip phones, huh? I bet that guy's not playing any Snake on that thing!
Snake! I wasted so much time on that game... Anyway, look at those clothes in the background. Don't they just scream 90s corporate to you?
Yeah, and not in the good, "I'm wearing all of Chandler's clothes" kind of way. Remember that time? Could I be wearing any more clothes?

How could I forget, Joey? And you managed to do lunges in them, that was impressive. But, oh, that poor guy on the phone. He probably has to stay within a ten-foot radius to keep service. And if he wanted to text? Forget it, he’d be pressing those buttons three times for one letter!
Ha! And remember when we had to keep that antenna thingy pulled out just right? If you moved a muscle, call's gone, connection's lost. It was like playing Jenga with your phone call!
Totally, Joey. And no selfies—how did we even survive? What did we even do without a camera on our phones?
Rach, you just forget about the selfies. You remember this? You take the camera, turn it around, guess where your face is, click, and hope for the best! Classic!
Hope for the best—sounds like a strategy you'd have for your auditions, Joey.
Hey! I'll have you know, it worked more times than not... I think. Anyway, he's probably having one of those intense phone conversations. You know the kind—like, "We were on a break!" intense.
Don't even start with that, Joey. But yes, he looks pretty serious. Maybe he's closing a big deal or ordering a pizza.
A pizza. Why didn't you say so? Now that's something I can relate to. You know, "The Joey Special" - two pizzas!
Okay, pizza sounds great. Let's order in and save this guy's flip phone memories for another day. How about I give you a "moo point" for every slice you eat, Joey?
Rach, you know a moo point is not gonna fill me up. But hey, as long as you're not making dessert, we're good. I still have nightmares about that beef trifle.
Oh well, lucky for you, I'll leave the cooking to Monica this time. Let's eat, Joey. But no stealing my slices, I mean it!
Rachel, have I ever told you 'Joey doesn't share food'? But for you, I might make an exception. Just this once.
So, I was thinking, if this meal were a line, could it BE any more straight?
Huh? What do you mean, Chan-man? That's just a nicely plated dinner.
I mean, look at it, Joe. The carrots, the broccoli, the rice – it’s like a culinary geometry lesson.
Who cares about geometry? I'm more interested in the meat. Is that beef? Man, I could go for some beef right now.
Right, because what's more important than the fabric of the universe is whether Joey gets his protein fix.
Exactly! You know, you should really learn to appreciate food like I do. This could be a beautiful steak smothered in...
Let me guess, custard? Jam? Because apparently, for you, everything mixed together is "good."
Hey, don't knock it 'til you've tried it! But seriously, this plating is kinda fancy. You taking cooking classes behind Monica's back or something?
Well you know me, I like to keep my wild rice and crazy carrots separate. The plate looks cleaner than when I try to organize my sock drawer.
Speaking of organizing, maybe if you did a better job, we'd still be roommates. Then every meal could look like this! Minus the veggies, of course.
But then how would you survive your 'meat sweats' without the balancing act of a broccoli forest?
With your sarcastic comments serving as a nice, cool breeze, my friend.
Look Joey! This image, it’s like the essence of childhood joy and innocence. Can you feel the vibe?
Yeah, Phoebs, it’s like Christmas morning in your pajamas. That’s the best! Wonder if they got any meatball subs in those presents.
No. I think you're missing the point, you know. These are kids, their presents are probably more like toys and books, not sandwiches.
Toys are good too. Hey, do you think Santa brought them a science boy or an ultimate fighting champion action figure?

Maybe, but look at them. The girl's got this kind of mystical aura, right? Like she's about to cast a happy spell with that bubble wand. And the bubbles! They're not just bubbles – they're orbs of childlike wonder.
You always have a cool way of looking at things, Phoebs. Anyway, I bet the kid's hoping one of those boxes is a foosball table. Man, I miss our old table.
Joey, we are focusing on the picture, stay with me. The holidays, remember? A time to be cozy and loving. And those two, they're probably siblings, doesn't it just melt your heart?

It does, it does. I love Christmas! All the food and the family... it reminds me of the time I built a fort with my sisters out of empty boxes. We stayed in there all day, pretending we were on a spaceship.
That sounds amazing. Spaceships, magic, being with the people you love. It’s what life’s all about, right? A never-ending journey through the stars.

Absolutely, Phoebs! And as long as there’s pizza on this spaceship, I'm good. But you're right, being with the people you love – that's what makes any place special. Friends or family, doesn't matter.
Exactly, like this little bubble universe we have right here with the gang. Hey, we should totally have a pajama day, like these kids! Wouldn’t that be a hoot?
Count me in, but no sharing food, okay? And I call dibs on the blue pajamas – they make my eyes pop!
Oh my gosh, Joey, look at this clock! Isn't it the most bizarre thing you've ever seen?
Whoa! Is that a clock or a spaceship? It's like if Salvador Dalí and George Lucas had a baby!
I know, right? It's so out there! It looks like it belongs in one of those high-end fashion stores I used to dream of working in.
Or on the set of "Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E."! Heh, imagine C.H.E.E.S.E. trying to figure out the time on this bad boy.
Oh Joey, I'm so glad you're not an interior decorator. Can you imagine the kind of stuff you'd put in people's homes?
Hey, it would be unique! Though, you're probably right... I mean, imagine having this in your living room. It would scare the 'bejesus' out of you every time it strikes the hour!
Absolutely, can you imagine? You're just sitting there, sipping your coffee, and suddenly it's like the invasion of the giant, time-telling robots!
"How you doin', Mr. Robot Clock?" Haha! Oh hey, does it remind you of the time I tried to build that entertainment unit?
Don't remind me! You nearly turned Chandler and Monica's apartment into splinters and sawdust. Let's just stick to buying our furniture, okay?
Deal. But Rach, if this is a real clock, I think we've found the perfect gift for Ross's birthday! He loves weird science-y stuff.
You know what, that's actually not the worst idea. But where would he put it? It's not exactly Emma-friendly—looks like it has tetanus.
Good point. Well, it'll always be 'moo' then! It's a moo point!
Joey, it's so comforting to know that some things never change.
Oh my God, look at that guy with his dogs! They're huge! Is that a Saint Bernard? The black one looks like a Rottweiler. They're practically taking over the bed!
Whoa... That's a lotta dog! Imagine the slobber! But hey, look how happy the guy looks smack in the middle of his furry buddies!
Happy? Sure. But Joey, imagine the hair everywhere. And the drool! Not just on the bed, but all over the apartment. I'd have to vacuum three times a day!
Yeah, but, Mon, you love cleaning. It's like your thing. "Not just clean, Monica clean," right?
True, I do love feeling like I've killed all possible germs, but this... this is not a battle, it's a full-on war. Although...  they do look pretty cuddly.
Hey, you remember when Chandler wanted a dog and you were all like, "No way because of the mess," but I saw you checking out those puppy ads last month.
I was not— okay, okay, I might have peeked. But puppies are different, Joey. They're... smaller.
Doesn’t matter the size, Mon, a dog's gonna shed. And chew. And do that thing with its leg when you scratch their belly. Heh, cracks me up every time.
Fine, but... at least tell me you'd never let them on the bed like that. Please.
On the bed? Monica, I'd let them sleep on my head if they wanted. And you know what they say, "The more, the merrier!"
Joey, that's for parties, not for dogs taking over your bed!
Same difference! Plus, if you get cold at night, you don't need a blanket – you've got a dog blanket!
I guess I can't argue with that logic. But if this were my bed, those dogs would be groomed, shampooed, and wearing little doggie slippers before they set one paw on my comforter.
Doggie slippers... Now, that's a look I gotta see. Hey, think Chandler would go for it?
Absolutely not—and neither would the dogs!
You know, one of them could be named Hugsy. He looks huggable like my penguin.
Joey, you're impossible.
And you wouldn't have me any other way! Right, Mon?
Right.  I can’t believe I’m saying this, but they are pretty adorable... even with the mess. Maybe we should consider getting a dog after all. Just not... not two big ones like that.
Ha! I knew I could get you to come around! How about a small one—tiny, like a... meatball!
Oh, Joey... only you would name a dog after food.
Oh wow, look Joey, it's a space shuttle projected on a monument! Do you think it's a sign from the universe?
Heh, Phoebs, the universe doesn't need to send a sign when it's got the real rockets, you know?
I don't know, Joey. It could be like a cosmic message or maybe a ghost of a space shuttle!
A ghost space shuttle? Phoebs, if there were ghosts, I'd be haunting the sandwich shop down the street, not floating around monuments.
Haha, that's true. But imagine the freedom, just soaring past stars and planets, exploring the galaxy... and maybe encountering alien life!
Sure, exploring is cool and all, but do you think aliens have pizza? If not, I'm staying right here.
I bet their pizza would be out of this world! Get it? 'Cause it's space pizza.
I get it! Just hope their pizza doesn't have anything weird on it, like… space anchovies.
No, no, space toppings are probably delightful. And imagine me, singing "Smelly Cat" in zero gravity. The intergalactic tour!
Totally! And maybe I can get a gig on a space soap opera, "Days of Our Space Lives" or something. My character would be the first to discover love on Mars!
That's the spirit, Joey! And I'd be...Regina Phalange, the interstellar explorer.
Just as long as Regina gets me back to Earth in time for my mom's lasagna, it's all good. Space is cool, but lasagna is forever, Phoebs.
Agreed, Joey. Home is where the heart—and the food—is. But a galactic detour would be quite the adventure. Shall we say 'beam us up'?
Absolutely, Phoebs! To infinity and beyond... well, you know what I mean. How you doin', space?
Oh my gosh, Joey, look at this image. Doesn't this tennis player remind you a little bit of Monica when she's in her hyper-competitive mode?
Heh, yeah, totally! It's like Monica's twin on the tennis court. Look at that focus; she's probably thinking about beating the ball like it owes her money.
Exactly! And that stance, I'm almost expecting her to start yelling at the ball any second now for not going where she wants it to!
Or, or she'll call a time-out, scribble some weird play on a napkin and try to make the poor ball follow that plan.
I can totally see her doing that. And do you notice the grip on that racket? I swear I've seen that same intense grip when Monica holds a spatula.
I wouldn't be surprised if she serves pancakes with that same spin she puts on a serve. That's probably her secret to those fluffy flapjacks.
Speaking of serving, Joey, imagine if instead of tennis balls, they were serving sandwiches. You'd be all over this court!
Rachel, there's something you gotta understand... when it comes to sandwiches, I'd be the one to beat!
Of course you would, Joey. Sandwiches and Joey, that's like the ultimate doubles team.
And don't forget “Joey doesn't share food!” No one's stealing this guy's lunch, no way.
I would never dream of it, Joey. But if this player is anything like Monica, she wouldn't share her winning shots either. She'd guard them with her life.
True that! She’d probably have a whole strategy session with the ball beforehand, promising it shiny new tennis ball friends if it lands just right.
Joey, that’s hilarious. Maybe we should send this picture to Monica with a note: "Found your long-lost sports sister."
She'd love that. But then, you know what would happen next, right? She'd want to challenge her to a match. And that...is a match I gotta see!
Only if we get front row seats, Joey. We could be like her cheer squad, with you bringing the sandwiches and me, the fashion critique.
Deal! But uh, Rachel, you gotta make sure those sandwiches are in a secure location... like my stomach, safest place on Earth.

It's a plan, Joey. Nobody's getting to your sandwiches. But let's make sure we let everyone else know not to mess with Monica’s game. She might not have a scary serve, but she's got that killer glare down.
Heck yeah, she does! That glare could scare off tennis pros, waiters, and even ducks in the park. It's legendary!
